Data: Agar to Bairstow, FOUR runs good cut from Bairstow now, this runs away behind point to the boundary
Agar to Bairstow, no run solid in defence now
Agar to Bairstow, no run quicker from Agar, pushed away to cover
Agar to Bairstow, 2 runs Agar has this habit of every now and then drifting one way down leg, and Bairstow sweeps this away to fine leg
Agar to Bairstow, no run leans forward to defend
Agar to Bairstow, no run solidly defended again
Siddle to Bell, no run a stifled shout from Siddle as this one drifts down leg and strikes the pad
Siddle to Bell, no run fullish and on off stump, no real swing and this ball is driven away to mid-off
Siddle to Bell, no run curling away from Bell, who leaves it alone
Siddle to Bell, 3 runs another really solid drive from Bell, this one wide of mid-off and Agar chases it down, reels it in but without any real speed in his legs
Siddle to Bairstow, no run very solid in defence on off stump
Siddle to Bairstow, no run Bairstow defends to off
Agar to Bell, 1 run fullish and outside off, it's driven away to deep point
Agar to Bairstow, no run drifting in to off and it's driven to cover
Agar to Bairstow, no run quicker and no drift from Agar, it's cut to point
Agar to Bairstow, no run leans forward and defends very solidly
Agar to Bairstow, no run flighted in and Bairstow jams down on the ball, it bounces high and back to Agar
Agar to Bairstow, no run faster from Agar, left alone outside off
Harris to Bell, no run length ball well wide of off stump, ignored
Harris to Bell, no run a touch fuller and a tighter line that makes Bell block up the wicket
Harris to Bell, no run width available outside off stump so Bell back-cuts but only finds gully on the bounce
Harris to Bell, 1 run a touch straight and whipped out through square leg to the man in the deep
Harris to Bairstow, no run short ball around off stump, gets inside the line very comfortably
Harris to Bairstow, 1 run fuller length and clipped off the hip down to long leg
Watson to Bairstow, no run full of length just outside off stump, driven at and gets the inner half of the bat towards mid-off

Watson to Bairstow, FOUR runs back of a length well outside off, Bairstow flashes at it without getting into a great position and got a thick top edge that flies over gully, slightly fortunate but a hard flash at a poor ball
Watson to Bairstow, no run full at the stumps - he missed this earlier - drives this more carefully to mid-on's left who saves
Watson to Bairstow, no run off stump length delivery, Bairstow blocks on the crease and pushes to cover
Watson to Bairstow, no run another length ball on off stump, blocked in the crease again
Watson to Bairstow, no run fuller on off stump, gently blocked up the wicket
Harris to Bell, no run length ball wide of off stump, ignored
Harris to Bell, no run tighter line, blocked with a forward nudge up the wicket
Harris to Bell, 1 run full ball at middle and off, blocked on the front foot and runs it into midwicket for a quick single
Harris to Bairstow, FOUR runs oh lovely drive straight back past mid-on, that was a delightful stroke and how the stroke should be played, straight down the ground
Harris to Bairstow, no run another nice straight drive, gets this to mid-off
Harris to Bairstow, no run wider of off stump, let go a foot and a half outside off
Watson to Bell, 1 run full on leg stump, clipped out to deep square leg
Watson to Bairstow, 1 run same line and this is again played out square through the leg side
Watson to Bell, no run full length just outside off, Bell drives with an open face but point dives to his left and saves
Watson to Bell, 2 runs back foot punch through the covers, an easy nudge away down the hill, gets a couple
Watson to Bell, no run full just outside off, a lovely flourish of the bat through the line, gets it to mid-off
Watson to Bell, no run back of a length just outside off, Bell tried to force it away off the back foot but didn't quite get it and it rolls to point
Harris to Bairstow, 2 runs back of a length and swatted through midwicket, literally was a swat, bit of a tennis volley, gets it wide of deep square leg for a couple
Harris to Bairstow, 2 runs two more towards the same region, this one flicked off the front foot
Harris to Bairstow, no run bumper, a little shorter than the first delivery, ignored
Harris to Bairstow, no run short outside off this time, again Bairstow doesn't flinch at it
Harris to Bairstow, 1 run full on middle, push firmly to midwicket where there's a fumble and they go on the misfield for a sharp single
Harris to Bell, no run length ball just outside off stump, played from the crease up the wicket

Pattinson to Bairstow, 3 runs yorker length outside off, Bairstow jams the bat down on it, it runs to Haddin's left, he picks up and shys automatically at the stumps but no-one is backing up so they'll get two buzzards
Pattinson to Bell, FOUR runs full length just outside off again, nicely driven, sweet cover drive, well timed, opens the face to get it in the gap and that's four down the hill all day long
Pattinson to Bell, no run yorker length, dug out on middle and off, big lbw appeal, it was probably sliding down, indeed it was, had Bell in a tangle though
Pattinson to Bell, no run length ball on the stumps, Bell stands in the crease and tucks up back to the bowler
Pattinson to Bell, (no ball) FOUR runs back of a length just outside off and gracefully pushed away through cover, that is glorious
Pattinson to Bell, no run tighter line and blocked up the wicket again
Pattinson to Bell, FOUR runs another back foot drive and again gloriously timed through the covers, down the hill and four more, superb stroke once again
Harris to Bairstow, no run now Bairstow tries a back foot punch but finds cover
Harris to Bairstow, no run fuller just outside off stump, driven nicely but only as far as mid-off
Harris to Bairstow, 1 run short ball, plays this swatted pull again and gets it out to deep square leg
Harris to Bell, no run full ball on the stumps, pressed forward and ran into the off side
Harris to Bell, no run played forward to a length ball on off stump, dropped into the covers but no chance of a single
Harris to Bell, no run good bumper, surprises Bell who shaped to hook but pulled out of the stroke at the last moment
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run length ball outside leg stump, tucked around the corner for an easy single
Agar to Bell, no run full on middle and off, blocked forward into the covers
Agar to Bell, no run leg stump line, tucked up on the leg side coming half-forward
Agar to Bell, no run forward on leg stump, ran back to the bowler
Agar to Bell, FOUR runs dropped slightly shorter and Bell is onto it in a flash, he rocks right back and chops hard, running it with the pace behind square
Agar to Bell, no run back on the stumps and full again, ran back up the wicket
Siddle to Bairstow, no run length ball on off stump, Bairstow forward and blocking up the wicket
Siddle to Bairstow, no run full ball on off stump, blocked up the wicket
Siddle to Bairstow, 1 run just loses his line a little bit and gets clipped through square leg, they run hard for two but the deep square is in too quickly
Siddle to Bell, no run off stump on a decent length, played forward and pushed into the covers
Siddle to Bell, no run off stump again and pushed up the wicket coming forward
Siddle to Bell, no run length ball on off stump and blocked on the crease once more
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run over the wicket now, length ball outside leg stump, flicked out to deep square leg, and Bairstow goes to fifty
Agar to Bell, no run floated up outside leg stump, kicked away
Agar to Bell, 1 run slightly straighter, Bell goes back and tucks through midwicket
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run floated up on leg stump, pushed through midwicket and they take on the fielder and get home comfortably because the fielder can't get in to pick up
Agar to Bell, no run kicked away outside leg again
Agar to Bell, no run straighter, around middle, blocked back up the wicket
Siddle to Bairstow, no run full ball on off stump, a bend of the front knee and blocked up the wicket
Siddle to Bairstow, no run forced off the back foot from just outside off, gets it to point
Siddle to Bairstow, no run another back foot push, this time can't evade cover who slides to his right to field
Siddle to Bairstow, no run finds another fielder, this time midwicket with a flick off middle and leg
Siddle to Bairstow, no run bumper on off stump, Bairstow sways inside the line quickly
Siddle to Bairstow, no run full of length around off stump, Bairstow forward and pushes up on the on side
Agar to Bell, no run around the wicket again, blocked on the back foot, played back up the wicket
Agar to Bell, no run fuller, pushed from off stump towards point
Agar to Bell, no run fuller again, this is driven from middle and off to cover with an open face
Agar to Bell, no run full on the stumps, rolled back up the wicket back to the bowler
Agar to Bell, (no ball) full on leg stump, rolled into midwicket this time, another no-ball for Agar
Agar to Bell, 1 run full way outside leg stump, Bell tucks it through the on side
Agar to Bairstow, 1 run down the wicket, first time we've seen that against Agar, driven firmly to mid-on and Bairstow calls for a quick single and makes it easily

Siddle to Bairstow, 1 run short and hooked, not in control of this and it's down towards deep backward square off a top edge but well short of the fielder, almost another cheap dismissal but well bowled, surprising the batsman with the short one that hurried him
Siddle to Bell, no run back of a length outside off and Bell brings the bat inside the line
Siddle to Bell, no run full ball just outside off stump, Bell forward and blocks into the covers
Siddle to Bell, no run full on off stump, driven nicely down to mid-on
Siddle to Bell, 1 run just outside off stump, dabbed from back of a length just to the right of point, they take the fielder on and get a quick single
Siddle to Bairstow, no run full a foot outside off stump, driven pretty firmly but extra cover comes around to save to his right
Agar to Bell, no run tossed up on off stump, punched to mid-off
Agar to Bell, no run tossed right up, Bell somehow misses it outside off stump and it very narrowly avoids the off stump, mid-read the flight there Bell
Agar to Bell, no run this is flatter, Bell rocks back and cuts hard to point
Agar to Bell, no run forward on middle stump to block up the wicket
Agar to Bell, no run touch short, Bell back and pushing into the covers from off stump
Agar to Bell, no run full on leg stump, blocked carefully back to the bowler
Siddle to Bairstow, no run full on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
Siddle to Bairstow, no run full and well wide of off stump, ignored
Siddle to Bairstow, no run length two feet outside off stump, ignored
Siddle to Bairstow, 1 run full ball pushed down the ground, Bairstow calls for a sharp single, mid-on comes in and throws down to the striker's end and had he hit Bell would have been gone, lazy
Siddle to Bell, 1 run back of a length, pulled out to deep square leg, very controlled stroke
Siddle to Bairstow, no run length ball wide of off stump, left alone
Agar to Bell, no run floated up on middle and leg, rolled back up the wicket
Agar to Bell, FOUR runs short outside off, cut for four, nicely put away, England waiting for these bad balls and Bell especially has been efficient in putting them away
Agar to Bell, no run floated up on middle and off, carefully blocking coming forward
Agar to Bell, 1 run leg stump line, flicked around the corner out to deep square leg
Agar to Bairstow, 2 runs full length on off stump, Bairstow drives while opening the face and steers it well into the gap at cover
Agar to Bairstow, FOUR runs not that short but Bairstow is quickly back and punching firmly past point down the hill, timed well, got into position very smartly
Pattinson to Bell, 1 run starts back of a length, pulled down to deep square leg
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run back of a length on off stump, defending up on his toes into the off side
Pattinson to Bairstow, 2 runs length ball on leg stump, tickled down the leg side, they get two as deep backward square comes to his right and it brings the 250 up
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run blocked in the crease around off stump again
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run blocked around off again, it comes off an inside edge and gets lodged in Bairstow's pad, he leaves it for Haddin to collect
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run played forward just outside off stump and pushed into the covers
Watson to Bell, no run blocked covering up on the off stump
Watson to Bell, no run length ball on the stumps, tucked to midwicket coming forward
Watson to Bell, no run full ball on the stumps, Bell nearly got outside it but nudges it to short midwicket
Watson to Bell, no run full and just outside off stump, driven towards extra cover
Watson to Bell, no run length on off stump, blocked up the wicket playing from the crease
Watson to Bell, no run covered up again on off stump, played up the wicket
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run back of a length outside off stump, played with a cross bat and gets it to point
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run tighter line, blocked on the back foot this time
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run in the channel just outside off, ignored
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run comes forward a little now and plays back up the wicket from off stump
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run full ball two feet just outside off stump, driven firmly to mid-on
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run forward on off stump, Bairstow forward and blocking back up the wicket
Watson to Bell, no run full on off stump, driven to mid-off

Watson to Bell, 3 runs another flowing drive, it was just a fraction wider which allowed Bell to open the face and steer it wide of cover...a good chase to the boundary by Smith, and a dive, saves a single
Watson to Bairstow, no run and he fields this delivery as Bairstow defends a length ball
Watson to Bairstow, no run dragged down short, he goes for the pull but doesn't time it and midwicket does the fielding
Watson to Bairstow, no run on a length, defended to the leg side, silly mid-on fields
Watson to Bairstow, no run pushed fuller, Bairstow again threatening to play around that front pad but plays it safely enough to midwicket
Pattinson to Bell, no run short of a length outside off, on the back foot and played to cover
Pattinson to Bell, no run fuller delivery, Bell doesn't get a massive stride forward as he drives to mid-off
Pattinson to Bell, no run driven more firmly this time, it was closer to a half volley, and again mid-off fields
Pattinson to Bell, 1 run defended off the back foot, squirts off a thick inside edge to deep square-leg
Pattinson to Bairstow, FOUR runs very nice shot, just timing as he flicks this from outside off through straight mid-on with a little turn of the bottom hand...lovely stuff from Bairstow
Pattinson to Bairstow, 1 wide that's a very short bouncer and it's too wide for the umpire
Pattinson to Bairstow, no run another bouncer to finish the over, this one is within the parameters as Bairstow ducks
Watson to Bell, 2 runs low full toss, tailing in a touch, Bell flicks it backward of square...the fielder is more at deep square than long leg so it's an easy two to take him to 99
Watson to Bell, no run a yorker, dug out and it bobbles to the leg side...no chance of the single
Watson to Bell, no run pushed down the leg side
Watson to Bell, 2 runs there it is! Another Ashes hundred for Ian Bell. He opens the face and steers backward of point, placement has been a hallmark of his hundred and this is another example
Watson to Bell, FOUR runs on leg stump, flicked away fine and the fielder at deep square has not chance of getting around
Watson to Bell, no run driven firmly towards the on side, there's a bit of a tangle as silly mid-on drives across to field and Bairstow falls off his feet as he swivels to get back into his ground
Siddle to Bairstow, no run on off stump, punched firmly back to the bowler
Siddle to Bairstow, no run finds an inside edge as Bairstow plays forward, it deflects into the pad and away to the off side
Siddle to Bairstow, no run full at off stump, search for the ball that bowled him earlier
Siddle to Bairstow, no run driven up to mid-on
Siddle to Bairstow, no run banged in short outside off, it loops off this friendly-paced surface and balloons through to Haddin
Siddle to Bairstow, no run back to the full length at off stump, driven to mid-off
Smith to Bell, no run starts full on middle, floated up, defended to the off side
Smith to Bell, no run full again, pushed back to the bowler...steady start
Smith to Bell, no run drifts towards leg stump, worked along the ground to midwicket
Smith to Bell, no run touch shorter and quicker, Bell goes onto the back foot in an attempt to drive
Smith to Bell, FOUR runs there's a full toss and Bell puts it away...used his feet then crunched it over wide mid-on. Didn't actually time it that well, but the power was enough

Smith to Bell, OUT he's done it! Clarke's captaincy brings another wicket. It's a perfectly-pitched leg break which grips a fraction, finds the edge and carries low to Clarke at slip. What a bonus for Australia
Siddle to Bairstow, no run short outside off, Bairstow drops his hands and lets it go through
Siddle to Bairstow, no run short again outside off, Bairstow isn't interested
Siddle to Bairstow, no run short of a length, makes him play this time, defended off the back foot
Siddle to Bairstow, no run keeps it on the short side, perhaps setting him up for the full straight one, defended to midwicket
Siddle to Bairstow, no run there's the full one, it's outside off, Bairstow gets forward and drives to cover

Siddle to Bairstow, no run close! So nearly an edge. Excellent delivery, short of a length, just offers to move away a fraction and Bairstow felt for it outside off stump. There were a few half shouts but nothing from the keeper
Smith to Prior, no run defended off the back foot
Smith to Prior, 1 run touch short, Prior stands on leg stump and cuts it out to the cover sweeper
Smith to Bairstow, 1 run some more turn, but it's a touch short and allows Bairstow to tuck it off the back foot through midwicket
Smith to Prior, 1 run placed off the back foot to deep cover
Smith to Bairstow, no run fuller on middle and off, Bairstow gets well forward to cover for the spin and defends
Smith to Bairstow, no run forward on off stump, pushed into the covers
Siddle to Prior, no run full at off stump, for a second it appeared Prior was going to be late on his defensive shot but plays it solidly to the off side
Siddle to Prior, no run defended back to the bowler

Siddle to Prior, no run well bowled, a slightly different action there for Siddle unless my eyes deceive me...trying to find some late swing, it was full at the stumps and Prior dug it out to midwicket
Siddle to Prior, no run full and straight, the way to go at Prior early, defended to the leg side
Siddle to Prior, no run offers the chance to drive a delivery full outside off, Prior frees his arms and picks out cover
Siddle to Prior, no run driven off the back foot to the right of mid-off where Harris makes a good tumbling save

Smith to Bairstow, OUT and another! It's a full toss. Bairstow has just bunted it back to Smith. Christmas time for Smith and Australia. An awfully lazy dismissal from Bairstow, who drove a fraction early and Smith collected a low chance in his follow through
Smith to Bresnan, no run quicker, flatter delivery which Bresnan defends to midwicket
Smith to Bresnan, no run forward and defends to the off side
Smith to Bresnan, FOUR runs dropped in short outside off, Bresnan rocks back nicely and finds the gap square through the off side
Smith to Bresnan, no run defended off the back foot to the leg side
Smith to Bresnan, 1 run full on leg stump, defended off a thick inside edge which dribbles towards short fine-leg
Siddle to Bresnan, no run on off stump, Bresnan gets forward and defends to the off side
Siddle to Bresnan, no run outside off, left alone
Siddle to Bresnan, no run worked into the leg side
Siddle to Bresnan, no run searching for that full delivery at the stumps, Bresnan punches it down to mid-on
Siddle to Bresnan, no run angling into him from wide on the crease, tucked out to midwicket
Siddle to Bresnan, no run a tight over from Siddle ends with a full delivery outside off which is defended to cover
Smith to Prior, no run on leg stump, defended back to the bowler
Smith to Prior, no run finds the edge again with one that spins quite sharply from around leg stump, it goes straight to ground and wide of slip
Smith to Prior, no run fuller this time, defended
Smith to Prior, FOUR runs cut away off the stumps, risky if the ball skids on, Prior cuts it through third man
Smith to Prior, no run gets forward and play it back to Smith
Smith to Prior, no run a little shorter, Prior hangs on the back foot and defends to backward point
Harris to Bresnan, no run resumes full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler in his follow through
Harris to Bresnan, no run a yorker which is dug out to the off side
Harris to Bresnan, no run left alone outside off, Harris still with the old ball
Harris to Bresnan, no run short of a length, seams back into Bresnan who defends off the back foot
Harris to Bresnan, no run on off stump, defended to the off side
Harris to Bresnan, no run played to the leg side
Smith to Prior, no run a little short on leg stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
Smith to Prior, no run that's nice from Smith, on middle and leg, threatening to turn, Prior defends
Smith to Prior, OUT he's got three! What a spell for Australia. This one skidded through outside off, perhaps an attempted flipper, Prior went for the cut and gets a healthy top edge to Haddin
Smith to Anderson, no run defended past slip off the back foot
Smith to Anderson, no run short outside off, defended to cover
Smith to Anderson, no run that's the length, fuller outside off, brings Anderson forward as he defends and it comes off a thick inside edge to midwicket
Harris to Bresnan, no run short of a length outside off, left alone
Harris to Bresnan, no run gets across and defends into the off side
Harris to Bresnan, 1 run ooh, nearly gets through, an attempted yorker which comes out as a low full toss but it tails late into Bresnan who manages to get the bottom of the bat on it
Harris to Anderson, no run feeling for this outside off as it is pushed across outside off...no footwork from Anderson
Harris to Anderson, no run touch fuller this time, outside off, Anderson nearly chases it before raised the bat out of the line
Harris to Anderson, 1 run excellent short ball, Anderson didn't really know much about it as he fends it away off the glove behind square on the leg side
Siddle to Broad, no run back of a length, down the leg side and Broad maybe gets a tickle of glove on it, the ball drops just in front of Haddin
Siddle to Broad, no run short and straight again, trying to playing the xylophone on Broad's ribs, he nudges it square
Siddle to Broad, FOUR runs he's not an easy man to intimidate, Broad, and although this isn't particularly short, he sits deep and clatters four over midwicket
Siddle to Broad, no run slightly back of a length, bit more pace in this delivery and Broad defends
Siddle to Broad, FOUR runs pitched up in the corridor, the ball's not doing much any more and Broad gets half a stride in before boofing a cover drive to the fence
Siddle to Broad, no run drops short again, doesn't get up all that much but Broad drops his hands under this one
Harris to Swann, FOUR runs too full and wide from Harris, his first poor ball this morning and Swann creams a drive through the covers for the eighth boundary of the morning
Harris to Swann, no run floated up wide of the stumps, chopped into the ground to point
Harris to Swann, FOUR runs drops a wee bit short and Swann continues to swing like a kid in the park, carting a pull shot from outside off towards deep midwicket, it beats square leg running round
Harris to Swann, FOUR runs four more, another drive through square! Harris' pace might be down a touch, it is a hot morning, and Swann sees this big, gets a stride in and clubs to the rope
Harris to Swann, 1 run nudged off the body through square
Harris to Broad, no run goes round the wicket, short and flying over Broad's shoulder as he hops in the crease
Smith to Anderson, 1 run short outside off, punched off the back foot to the right of mid-off
Smith to Bresnan, no run another full toss, perhaps a tactic, and this one is driven on the bounce back to Smith
Smith to Bresnan, 1 run finds another edge, lovely length on middle and off, it turns but goes low and wide of slip
Smith to Anderson, no run full at off stump, defended to the covers
Smith to Anderson, no run beaten by a very full delivery which he seemed to just play over the top off...bounces awkwardly for Haddin who can't take it cleanly
Smith to Anderson, no run strangled appeal for lbw but it pitched outside leg stump
Harris to Bresnan, no run full on middle, squares Bresnan up a little as he defends towards mid-on
Harris to Bresnan, no run short of a length, angled down the leg side, and this is a good diving save to his left by Haddin
Harris to Bresnan, no run poor shot late in the day, chases a full wide delivery that he could barely reach...it swung
Harris to Bresnan, no run much closer to off stump, full length, left alone
Harris to Bresnan, no run good length at middle and off, defended to the leg side
Harris to Bresnan, no run full at off stump, comes forward and defends square into the off side
Siddle to Swann, 1 run straight, on a length and tucked through square leg for one

Siddle to Broad, FOUR runs shot! This was a length ball outside off, Broad stretched himself up to his full height and punched it straight back down the ground, Swann ducking underneath to avoid taking any damage
Siddle to Broad, 1 run bumper, well-directed up towards the chest, hoicked round the corner for a single
Siddle to Swann, no run
Siddle to Swann, 3 runs goes after another length ball, hitting through the line and lofting the ball high over mid-off, it plops into the outfield and doesn't quite roll all the way

Siddle to Broad, SIX runs another boundary, this time a six, though I'm not quite sure Usman Khawaja picked it up out at deep square leg! Broad pulled a short ball, the bat rolled in his hand a touch and it looped very high, Khawaja was in off the rope, suddenly he realised that he needed to backpedal and the ball eventually dropped safe a few inches over the rope - might have one the fielder could have got his hands under, though
Harris to Swann, no run round the wicket, swings across the line and the ball rolls down the track
Harris to Swann, no run back of a length, seaming across and Swann tries a cute, late uppercut but misses
Harris to Swann, no run bumper, Swann fends at it and the manages to play it down on to the pitch

Harris to Swann, FOUR runs dug in short and again Swann climbs into it, sending the ball in a soaring arc out towards fine leg, deep square was in and won't get round in time, as it bounces to the boundary
Harris to Swann, no run swats across the line but doesn't connect
Harris to Swann, no run length on the stumps, played back in more conservative fashion

Pattinson to Broad, OUT nicked to the keeper, the partnership is ended two short of fifty! Or is it? Broad doesn't walk, naturally, and has a wee conflab with Swann before deciding to review. This looks a bit hopeful, as there was a clear deviation on the way through... Though replays show it hit the flap of the pad, too. Hot Spot picks up a faint edge, though, so any more Broad controversy is quickly put to bed. England are all out

11.55am: England's tail finally wagged, a brief spell of happy slogging to cheer the crowd after more sterling work from Ryan Harris secured his place on the honours board. As Swann and Broad showed, these are still good conditions to have a bat... but Australia have to get everything straight between their ears. Join us in ten to see how they go.

Extraordinary that in this series, fifth-wicket pairs are the only ones that have been more productive than last-wicket partnerships. Here's a first-wicket pairing now, out walk Shane Watson and Chris Rogers for Australia's innings. James Anderson to begin.
Anderson to Watson, no run left alone outside off
Anderson to Watson, no run Watson shapes to play at this but then brings the bat back inside

Anderson to Watson, no run lovely delivery! Oh what a cracker for Watson to have to negotiate in this first over! It's on middle and off and just curving away a fraction, Anderson puts up a huge shout for caught behind but Kumar Dharmasena says not out. Anderson wants a review, but the consensus from the England players is not to go for it, and that's a wise call. It was off the back leg, not bat
Anderson to Watson, no run Watson shoulders arms now
Anderson to Watson, no run accurate stuff from Anderson and Watson defends
Anderson to Watson, no run inswing this time and it moves late, good bowling from Anderson, but Watson is still able to leave it alone safely as it doesn't move enough to threaten his off stump
Broad to Rogers, no run good line straight away, just outside off and swinging in a touch, and Rogers defends
Broad to Rogers, no run swinging down the leg side now and Rogers tries to tickle it fine but gets nothing on it
Broad to Rogers, no run again it's curling down leg, again Rogers makes no contact
Broad to Rogers, no run outside off now and Rogers defends with a straight bat
Broad to Rogers, no run ouch, Rogers is beaten by one that nips in a fraction and bounces - it's struck him fair in the midriff
Broad to Rogers, no run squared up now and Rogers pushes to off
Anderson to Watson, no run great bowling from Anderson, fast and swinging away a fraction, from middle stump and Watson is naturally squared up. Gets a thickish edge away to off
Anderson to Watson, no run plays late this time and defends safely
Anderson to Watson, no run not so good a delivery now, angling down the leg side and Watson's attempted glance doesn't connect
Anderson to Watson, no run another thick edge from Watson, but soft hands means this doesn't carry to second slip
Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs first boundary for Australia now as Watson waits on a slightly shorter one and steers it off the back foot down into the ground and away behind point
Anderson to Watson, no run wider of off now and Watson slashes, he's missed it
Broad to Rogers, no run angled across Rogers, who leaves it alone
Broad to Rogers, 1 run Rogers gets off the mark now with a flick through midwicket from a ball that swings in
Broad to Watson, no run curving away outside off and Watson theatrically leaves the ball alone
Broad to Watson, no run probing outside off now but no real swing there and Watson defends solidly
Broad to Watson, no run angled in to the off stump line now and Watson defends

Broad to Watson, no run there's an appeal for lbw, it is turned down by Marais Erasmus. England appeared confident but after a conference between bowler, keeper and captain, they decide not to review and it's another wise call. That looked like it struck Watson outside the line of off, and replays confirm it.
Anderson to Rogers, no run Anderson is, clearly, back on the field now, but swings this ball way down leg
Anderson to Rogers, no run strikes Rogers on the pad now but this was pitching well outside leg as Anderson is over the wicket
Anderson to Rogers, no run wrong line again from Anderson, swinging down leg and Rogers can't get anything on it
Anderson to Rogers, no run another one down leg, this one flicks the pad on the way through to Prior, who dives and collects it
Anderson to Rogers, no run on off stump now and Rogers defends to leg
Anderson to Rogers, no run defended away to the leg side again
Broad to Watson, no run Watson defends from outside off
Broad to Watson, no run a stifled shout now from Broad as Watson gets a big stride in and is hit on the pad
Broad to Watson, FOUR runs super shot from Watson now, fullish from Broad and Watson pounces with an off-drive that is more muscle than finesse, but races away to the boundary in any case
Broad to Watson, no run tries for another off drive now but straight to mid-off
Broad to Watson, no run fuller and swinging in a touch now, another stifled shout for lbw, this too was off a thick inside edge
Broad to Watson, no run left alone outside off now
Anderson to Rogers, no run Anderson sends this down at 85.3mph, it's left alone outside off,
Anderson to Rogers, no run left alone outside off again
Anderson to Rogers, 3 runs Rogers pushes this one back past Anderson, just a little jab really, but good enough to pick up three as the batsmen scamper through quickly
Anderson to Watson, no run swinging in towards off now, Watson defends with bat and pad close together
Anderson to Watson, no run Watson looks good with this drive, straight bat and firmly struck, but Pietersen at mid-on prevents any runs
Bresnan to Rogers, 2 runs fullish and outside off, just put on the spot by Bresnan, and Rogers drives past mid-off to pick up some more runs
Bresnan to Rogers, no run probing on off stump, no real swing for Bresnan, and Rogers defends
Bresnan to Rogers, no run left alone outside off
Bresnan to Rogers, no run swing this time - but swinging well away from Rogers, who leaves it alone
Bresnan to Rogers, no run on the pads and Rogers clips it to midwicket
Bresnan to Rogers, no run whippy flick to square leg to end the over
Anderson to Watson, no run Watson defends to the off side safely

Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs that's a classic Watson drive, he gets the big stride in and makes the ball fuller than it might otherwise have been, and he punches the drive through extra cover with power and timing
Anderson to Watson, no run solidly defended to the off side
Anderson to Watson, no run Anderson brings the length back just a touch, Watson leans forward and across to defend

Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs again Watson drives nicely through off, this time from a ball not quite so full and it's more the timing of this one than strength, he's found the gap between point and cover

Anderson to Watson, 3 runs yet more runs for Watson, this time he stands tall and off the back foot steers it behind point, it appears to be running away to the boundary but Jonny Bairstow has done magnificently in his chase and dive, flicks it back in to the field of play with his left hand - just within the bounds of play

Bresnan to Watson, FOUR runs Watson is really on song now! No swing for Bresnan and Watson just pushes this drive through extra cover, it was in the spot but still the placement was good. Yet another boundary
Bresnan to Watson, no run straighter line and Watson defends
Bresnan to Watson, FOUR runs another boundary! The runs are flowing, Bresnan gives him some more width now and Watson cuts this one away fine, well behind point, easy runs
Bresnan to Watson, 2 runs strays on to the pads this time and Watson flicks it away towards deep square leg, there is a man back there so this one doesn't add to his boundary tally
Bresnan to Watson, no run better line and length, Watson defends to off
Bresnan to Watson, no run Watson gets back to defends this straight one
Anderson to Rogers, 2 runs swings in towards the pads and Rogers just clips it along the ground out towards deep square
Anderson to Rogers, no run defended back to Anderson
Anderson to Rogers, no run better line outside off and it's defended to cover
Anderson to Rogers, no run bangs in the bouncer from around the wicket, Rogers ducks under it with a distinct lack of concern
Anderson to Rogers, no run defended away to the leg side
Anderson to Rogers, no run solid in defence again
Swann to Watson, no run turning in from outside off, Watson defends
Swann to Watson, 1 run shorter from Swann, Watson tucks it away behind square leg
Swann to Rogers, no run drifting in from around the wicket, Rogers defends
Swann to Rogers, 2 runs wristy from Rogers now as Swann drops short and angles it in to off stump, it's flicked away through midwicket
Swann to Rogers, 2 runs more flight this time and it's fuller, Rogers drives square through point. He's not finding the boundary like Watson but he's looking solid
Swann to Rogers, no run slow stuff from Swann and Rogers defends
Bresnan to Watson, no run angled in towards off, he's looking for the lbw in this over, but Watson defends
Bresnan to Watson, no run swinging in this time and Watson leaves it alone
Bresnan to Watson, no run shoulders arms again

Bresnan to Watson, OUT Bresnan strikes! He has Watson lbw in the last over before lunch! Great ball, angled in and Watson moved across with the front pad and missed the ball, he's rapped right in front and Dharmasena gives it lbw. Watson chats for a while with Rogers and eventually makes the decision to review it. It's a poor decision because that was plumb. That's not how to use the review system
Bresnan to Khawaja, no run good length, pushed across and defended on the front foot outside off
Bresnan to Khawaja, 2 runs drops short, at the body, Khawaja nudges it away through square leg and they get back for a couple

Swann to Rogers, no run tapped into the off side and this very nearly results in Rogers running himself out, as Khawaja sends him back! He had to do a U-turn in the middle of the pitch as the throw came in - a direct hit would have done for him
Swann to Rogers, no run tossed up and this rags hard past the outside edge as Rogers plays from the crease
Swann to Rogers, no run tossed up and defended
Swann to Rogers, no run more spin as Rogers leans out, covers the line and drives to backward point
Swann to Rogers, no run full and flighted, straightening a touch outside off as Rogers leaves
Swann to Rogers, no run goes back to a wide delivery and pokes it square on the off side
Bresnan to Khawaja, 3 runs not much footwork and Khawaja fences away from his body, a thick edge flies low through the gully region, Cook gives chase and prevents four
Bresnan to Rogers, no run length ball, around off stump, steered toward point
Bresnan to Rogers, no run straighter, worked off the pads towards midwicket, no run
Bresnan to Rogers, 3 runs on the pads, touch fuller this time and Rogers neatly picks him off between midwicket and mid-on
Bresnan to Khawaja, no run slightly back of a length, in the corridor, Khawaja drops back and shoulders arms
Bresnan to Khawaja, no run good, probing line, on a length and drawing Khawaja forwards, he opens the face and steers to point
Swann to Rogers, no run tossed up and defended into the off side

Swann to Rogers, OUT what on earth has happened here? He's missed a full toss and been hit in front ... Erasmus raises a finger and England have another, though both batsman and bowler are shaking their heads! This is like the tactic of bowling a slow full toss on Brian Lara Cricket, though there was no intent on Swann's part. The ball slipped out of the hand and Rogers was slow to sight it, missed swinging across the line and got hi
Swann to Hughes, 1 run tossed up outside off and pushed into a gap in the covers first ball
Swann to Khawaja, no run angled in with the arm and blocked
Swann to Khawaja, no run gets forward to defend in front of off
Swann to Khawaja, 1 run hops back and prods at a length ball straightening outside off, skids away off the outside edge
Bresnan to Khawaja, no run gets forward to a length ball in the channel
Bresnan to Khawaja, no run good length, Khawaja gets a stride in and blocks into the off side
Bresnan to Khawaja, no run length and in the channel outside off, steady line from Bresnan, this time Khawaja leaves
Bresnan to Khawaja, no run stays in the crease, pushes away from the body but keeps it down towards point
Bresnan to Khawaja, 1 run gets forward and pushes one into a gap in the covers
Bresnan to Hughes, no run pitched up a little fuller, Hughes stays in the crease and punches to mid-off
Swann to Khawaja, no run dances forward and manages to jam his gloves down on to at as the ball threatens to spins past him
Swann to Khawaja, no run angled in and defended

Swann to Khawaja, no run dropped, a dolly for Trott at first slip! Khawaja pushes at a regulation offbreak and guided it into the fielder's hands but it popped straight out of the confectionery stand and to the turf
Swann to Khawaja, no run tossed up and blocked pressing forwards
Swann to Khawaja, no run a big lbw appeal this time, bat thrust forward next to pad, hard to tell which took the impact first and might have been outside the line of off, Erasmus shakes his head
Swann to Khawaja, no run floated up and defended coming forwards
Bresnan to Hughes, no run squares him up and beats the outside edge, Hughes jumping around like a cat in his crease
Bresnan to Hughes, no run angled across and this time Hughes gets in line to defend
Bresnan to Hughes, no run pushed across the bows on a good length and left alone
Bresnan to Hughes, no run length delivery, defended around the line of off
Bresnan to Hughes, no run gets forward to defend a length ball into the covers

Bresnan to Hughes, OUT Hughes throws his hands at a wide one, very loose shot from a new batsman, there's a limp sort of appeal, particularly from Bresnan but it's immediately upheld by Dharmasena! Hughes reviews without hesitation, so he must be pretty confident he didn't hit it... So, let's see if there's evidence to overturn the decision. Hot Spot is pretty inconclusive, maybe a faint mark, there was a sound on the audio and Tony
Swann to Khawaja, no run tossed up, defended back down the track
Swann to Khawaja, no run very full, gets across to defend
Swann to Khawaja, no run bit of spin for Swann again, Khawaja pushing at it with hard hands
Swann to Khawaja, no run tossed up and defended coming forwards
Swann to Khawaja, 1 run floated up on the stumps, worked through the leg side for a single
Swann to Clarke, no run angled in with the arm, minimal turn and Clarke defends in front of off

Bresnan to Khawaja, 1 run stays back and drops into the off side, they scamper one but Bairstow swoops on it and hits one stumps from square! They go upstairs to the third umpire again, but Clarke is quick across the ground and was just in
Bresnan to Clarke, no run back of a length in the channel outside off, doesn't do much off the pitch and Clarke lets it through
Bresnan to Clarke, FOUR runs touch too full, wide of the stumps and Clarke rattles his hands through a square drive, races away for his first runs
Bresnan to Clarke, no run pitched up, homing in around off stump, blocked to leg
Bresnan to Clarke, no run length ball, goes across and jabs defensively into the off side
Bresnan to Clarke, 2 runs straight line, flicked off a length through square leg and they hurry back for a second
Swann to Khawaja, no run very full, Khawaja plays around his front pad and defends into the off side
Swann to Khawaja, 1 run drifts to leg, closes the face and clips one past the attendant close fielder
Swann to Clarke, 1 run tossed up around the line of off, punched into the off side, to the left of mid-off and they steal one
Swann to Khawaja, FOUR runs back round the wicket, arm ball drifting on to the pads and Khawaja plays it well, from deep in the crease and glancing it fine for a boundary
Swann to Khawaja, no run full and flighted outside the line of off, defended
Broad to Clarke, no run gets forward to defend the ball into the off side
Broad to Clarke, no run pitched up a little in the corridor, blocked towards mid-off coming forwards
Broad to Clarke, no run good length, on off stump, gets across and shows it the maker's name
Broad to Clarke, 1 run drops short, over the top of the stumps, clipped through square for a single
Broad to Khawaja, no run slightly back of a length, pushed across the left-hander from over the wicket, left alone
Broad to Khawaja, no run continues to fire it down the corridor, goodish length and Khawaja again watches it through
Swann to Clarke, no run tossed up, knocked back down the track
Swann to Clarke, 1 run skips forward to get to the pitch and fiddle a single through the leg side
Swann to Khawaja, no run leans out to defend and edged again, this time low into the ground towards slip, where Trott is on his knees to stop it
Swann to Khawaja, no run full, flighted, defended in front of off

Swann to Khawaja, OUT Khawaja on the charge, he's hit this over the top... except it doesn't go over, it merely loops high off the toe and into the hands of KP at mid-off! He hasn't looked comfortable against Swann, surviving a drop at slip and defending somewhat anxiously in front of his pad, obviously decided he didn't want to die in a hole - so he perished in no-man's land instead
Swann to Clarke, no run tossed up and turning in from outside off, defended coming forward
Broad to Smith, no run slightly back of a length and defended into the leg side as Smith walks across his wicket
Broad to Smith, no run pitched up, around off, blocks coming forward
Broad to Smith, no run tight line on off, Smith again shows an immaculate defence to a fullish ball
Broad to Smith, no run very full and wide of the stumps, Smith watches it through
Broad to Smith, no run angled in towards off stump, another solid defensive shot
Broad to Smith, no run good length, the bat comes down at a slight angle to block towards mid-off
Swann to Clarke, no run drifts this one past the outside edge of Clarke, to the general excitement of the England fielders
Swann to Clarke, no run floated up outside off, Clarke gets forward and covers the line
Swann to Clarke, no run full and straight, chipped back towards mid-on
Swann to Clarke, no run tossed up outside off, Clarke advances and drives back to the bowler
Swann to Clarke, FOUR runs drops slightly short, room for Clarke to free the arms and crack a cut shot in front of point, that came off the bat like a bullet
Swann to Clarke, 1 run floated up on the leg stump, gets forward and flicks round the corner for one mpre
Broad to Clarke, no run good length, around the line of off, defended
Broad to Clarke, no run turned into the leg side
Broad to Clarke, no run pitched up and Clarke advances with menacing intent, smacks the cover off a drive but straight into the stumps at the other end
Broad to Clarke, FOUR runs very full and in the slot, Clarke drives again, gets a good chunk of the ball and it beats Bresnan's dive moving to his left at mid-off, four more
Broad to Clarke, no run bumper, outside off, Clarke eschews the shot on this occasion
Broad to Clarke, 1 run short of a length, goes across and works the ball to deep backward square
Swann to Clarke, 1 run squeezed off the inside edge just past short leg
Swann to Smith, no run Smith leans forward to defend
Swann to Smith, no run again Smith defends a quicker ball outside off
Swann to Smith, 1 run flattish again and turning in to off, Smith works it through square leg
Swann to Clarke, no run good use of the feet from Clarke, he advances and then defends
Swann to Clarke, no run watchfully defended again
Broad to Smith, 1 run swinging in on to the pads and it's clipped through square leg
Broad to Clarke, no run a bit shorter of a length now and Clarke defends with a straight bat
Broad to Clarke, no run bouncer this time, Clarke thinks about hooking but ducks under it

Broad to Clarke, 3 runs nicely played by Clarke, it was short of a length and he drives off the back foot between cover and mid-off, it looks like running away for a boundary but Bresnan does well to reel that in
Broad to Smith, no run bouncer again, and Smith ducks it
Broad to Smith, no run again Broad bangs it in short, again Smith ducks it comfortably
Swann to Clarke, no run quickish from Swann, a touch of turn, and Clarke defends
Swann to Clarke, no run same again from Swann, same again from Clarke
Swann to Clarke, 1 run good use of the feet as Clarke advances to Swann and works it off his pads through midwicket along the ground, just a gentle push
Swann to Smith, no run Smith uses his feet too - he's the best player of spin besides Clarke around the Australian group at the moment - and clips it to midwicket
Swann to Haddin, no run on the back foot, Haddin nudges it down into the ground to Bell

Broad to Clarke, no run Clarke flashes at this outside off! Didn't move the feet at all, and that has beaten the outside edge. You have to wonder if Clarke has decided he's going to go after the bowlers
Broad to Clarke, FOUR runs that, however, is a much better stroke. A bit shorter from Broad and Clarke whips this pull dismissively through midwicket, fine timing and placement
Broad to Clarke, no run swinging in a touch now and Clarke defends
Broad to Clarke, no run fullish length and Clarke drives to mid-off
Broad to Clarke, no run banged in short of a length and Clarke nudges it to point
Broad to Clarke, 1 wide bouncer, but it's too high to worry Clarke. It has worried umpire Dharmasena, though. He calls it wide.
Swann to Haddin, no run turns in towards the stumps and Haddin defends
Swann to Haddin, no run defensive again from Haddin
Swann to Haddin, no run some turn for Swann, and Haddin defends
Swann to Haddin, 1 run a touch too straight now, allows Haddin to push through midwicket and add to the score
Swann to Agar, no run defended comfortably outside off
Swann to Agar, 1 leg bye drifting towards leg stump and there's not really a shout for lbw, Agar picks up a leg bye
Broad to Agar, no run pushed away towards the off side
Broad to Agar, no run wafty from Agar outside off, he's tried to dab it through point but can't make contact
Broad to Agar, no run angled across Agar, who defends
Broad to Agar, no run Agar goes for the pull off a shortish ball, but mistimes it straight down into the ground
Broad to Agar, no run probing just outside off and Agar defends
Broad to Agar, no run and again Agar defends to the off side
Swann to Haddin, no run turns in towards off and Haddin defends with a straight bat
Swann to Haddin, no run solidly defended again by Haddin, who has a lot riding on his shoulders now
Swann to Haddin, no run Swann not flighting it much to Haddin, he's going flatter, and Haddin defends
Swann to Haddin, no run just a fraction more flight now and it's driven back to the bowler
Swann to Haddin, no run again Haddin leans forward to defend outside off
Swann to Haddin, no run Haddin off the back foot punches to mid-off
Anderson to Agar, no run pushed away to the off side
Anderson to Agar, no run some width now and Agar cuts it to point
Anderson to Agar, no run solidly defended from on the pads
Anderson to Agar, no run awkwardly defended this time, Agar looks a bit hampered by this sore hip that he has. He's certainly missing a bit of the joie de vivre he displayed at Trent Bridge
Anderson to Agar, no run pushed away towards point
Anderson to Agar, no run angled across Agar again, and he defends
Swann to Haddin, no run turning in to Haddin, who punches off the back foot towards cover, can't find the gap
Swann to Haddin, no run kicked away by Haddin, who just thrusts the pad outside off to a ball that wasn't turning much
Swann to Haddin, no run defensive again - the runs have dried up here
Swann to Haddin, no run straighter line from Swann, Haddin tries to flick it through leg but again, no gap to be found
Swann to Haddin, 1 run this time they do find a run as Haddin just pushes it through cover
Swann to Agar, no run solid in defence from Agar
Anderson to Haddin, no run fullish and on line, Haddin drives towards mid-on

Anderson to Haddin, no run a big lbw appeal from Anderson now, he's keen but the umpire is not, and nor is Matt Prior. What a system England have in place! That was comfortably sailing down leg and too high to boot
Anderson to Haddin, no run solidly defended by Haddin, no swing for Anderson
Anderson to Haddin, no run probing around off stump and Haddin defends
Anderson to Haddin, no run worked away to the off side but he can't beat point
Anderson to Haddin, no run straight-bat defence again from Haddin
Swann to Agar, no run Agar defends on off stump, no turn from Swann
Swann to Agar, 2 runs Agar gets off the mark at last, from his 17th delivery, with a cut behind point off a shortish ball
Swann to Agar, no run sharp turn out of the footmarks - it has spun all the way to first slip! Agar wasn't interested in trying to hit that
Swann to Agar, no run faster ball, Agar defends
Swann to Agar, no run Agar leans forward out of his crease to defend
Swann to Agar, no run fullish ball and Agar digs it out, drives to mid-off
Anderson to Haddin, no run Anderson continues to probe on off, Haddin continues to defend with a straight bat
Anderson to Haddin, no run defends away to the off side
Anderson to Haddin, no run short of a length, Haddin works it to leg
Anderson to Haddin, no run punched off the back foot to point
Anderson to Haddin, no run Haddin looks to have timed this straight drive well, but Anderson gets a hand to it and the deflection is collected by mid-off - no run again

Anderson to Haddin, OUT oh dear! Agar has been run out! What a terrible mix-up! At first glance it appears Haddin has let his partner down here. It was shortish on the hips and lobbed up, perhaps off the body, behind square leg. Prior ran around to collect and Agar was running through for a single. It was Agar's call as it was behind the batsman, but Haddin didn't respond. He barely even left his crease. Agar made it three quarters o
Swann to Siddle, no run Siddle leans forward to defend
Swann to Siddle, no run no real turn for Swann, Siddle defends
Swann to Siddle, no run Siddle uses his feet nicely, and then defends
Swann to Siddle, no run quicker from Swann, trying to squeeze through Siddle's defence - unsuccessfully
Swann to Siddle, no run Siddle defends once more
Swann to Siddle, no run and another maiden is registered as Siddle - yep - defends
Anderson to Haddin, no run solidly defended by Haddin
Anderson to Haddin, no run defended once more by Haddin
Anderson to Haddin, no run angling in towards the pads of Haddin, who clips it to leg
Anderson to Haddin, no run defended again by Haddin
Anderson to Haddin, no run solidly defended once more, Anderson continues to probe on line but without any swing
Anderson to Haddin, no run straight-bat defence from Haddin
Swann to Siddle, no run over the wicket, tossed up on off stump and defended pressing forwards
Swann to Siddle, no run pushed through, slightly flatter, bit of bounce and blocked
Swann to Siddle, no run Siddle gets down to sweep, taking it from outside off into the ground, can't get it past short leg
Swann to Siddle, no run floated up and pushed back down the track
Swann to Siddle, no run angled in on the stumps, gets forward and taps into the leg side
Swann to Siddle, 1 run full and drifting in around off, Siddle opts to sweep again and gets one out to deep backward square
Anderson to Siddle, no run slightly back of a length, around off stump, gets across and covers the line
Anderson to Siddle, no run dug in again, Siddle does well to ride the bounce and keep it down
Anderson to Siddle, no run goes back and across and defends again
Anderson to Siddle, no run length ball in the channel, left alone by the batsman
Anderson to Siddle, no run full and angled in on the pads before straightening as Siddle tries to turn to leg, gets a leading edge square on the off side
Anderson to Siddle, no run good length and homing in on off, Siddle shows it the face in defence
Swann to Haddin, 1 run spinning in off a length from outside off, waits on it and tucks one into the leg side
Swann to Siddle, no run on the stumps, turned to midwicket
Swann to Siddle, 1 run full and wide of the stumps, Siddle sweeps competently through backward square for another single
Swann to Haddin, no run gets forward and dabs defensively to leg
Swann to Haddin, no run full and flighted outside the line of off, defended with a straight bat
Anderson to Siddle, no run short and wide and steered with a horizontal blade out towards point
Anderson to Siddle, no run pitched up on the stumps, blocked back on the on side
Anderson to Siddle, 1 wide hammers this into the deck, very short and it loops up well over the head of the batsman
Anderson to Siddle, no run goes across his stumps and prods a fullish ball towards mid-on
Anderson to Pattinson, no run beaten outside off, a teaser to begin with that pitched on middle and seams away as the batsman prodded at it
Anderson to Pattinson, no run pitched up and Pattinson gets behind this to defend square
Swann to Haddin, no run flat trajectory, worked off the pads to leg
Swann to Haddin, no run full and blocked on the front foot
Swann to Haddin, no run stands up and defends into the pitch around off
Swann to Harris, 2 runs length ball, sits up outside off and neatly punched through the covers for a couple
Swann to Harris, 2 runs drops slightly short and Harris stays back, dabs another brace through point
Anderson to Pattinson, no run good length in the channel and Pattinson gets forward to defend
Anderson to Pattinson, no run edged but this scoots low towards third slip, who dives to make the stop. The ball was pushed across Pattinson and clipped the outside edge as the bat scissored down
Anderson to Pattinson, no run good length and seaming across the left-hander, who leaves
Anderson to Pattinson, no run short and at the man, Patto ducks underneath

Anderson to Pattinson, 3 runs another low edge screws away wide of third slip, Pattinson did well to keep it down and Jonny Bairstow does even better to keep them to three with a dive to the rope, almost swimming across the turf to fingertip it back in
Anderson to Harris, 1 run a big inducker from Anderson, full and homing on middle and leg, Harris plays around the front pad and picks up one through square
Swann to Harris, no run pushed through on the stumps, blocked into the off side
Swann to Harris, 1 run tossed up and Harris has a hack, the ball flying past short midwicket and on the bounce towards a half-back long-on
Swann to Pattinson, no run goes round the wicket, tossed up and blocked back down the track
Swann to Pattinson, no run slightly shorter, this bounces up at Pattinson, who dead-bats it from the crease
Swann to Pattinson, no run full and straightening, squeezed away square
Swann to Pattinson, no run floated up wide of the stumps, the batsman gets forward and dabs into the covers
Anderson to Harris, no run pitched up on the stumps, worked to leg and midwicket collects
Anderson to Harris, no run stays in the crease and blocks a shorter-length ball into the covers
Anderson to Harris, no run good length, in the channel outside off, Harris watches it by
Anderson to Harris, no run goes for the bumper, again the ball doesn't get up that high but Harris crams his big frame into a tight little ball underneath it
Anderson to Harris, no run good length, on the stumps, blocked to leg

Anderson to Harris, no run full and veering down the leg side, nearly knocks Harris off his feet, Dharmasena shakes his head. England decide that DRS has been good to them, and duly review ... only for Hawk-Eye to prove what the naked eye could see. In fact, the ball pitched outside leg, never mind the impact. Tsk
Swann to Pattinson, 1 run squeezes a single out square on the off side
Swann to Harris, no run full and on the stumps, blocked back and Swann collects in front of mid-on
Swann to Harris, no run flighted, straight line, played back to the bowler
Swann to Harris, no run very full, bit of air and drifting towards leg stump, turned to leg
Swann to Harris, FOUR runs drops short outside off and Harris totters back to middle a cut shot through point - here begineth the marathon last-wicket defiance, then
Swann to Harris, no run good length, doesn't really turn much, Harris gets in line behind his bat and blocks
Broad to Pattinson, 2 runs stands tall and steers a back-of-a-length ball through backward point with an open face, Bairstow hares after it, though fails to gather at the first attempt
Broad to Pattinson, no run good length, pushed across from over the wicket, stoutly defended into the covers
Broad to Pattinson, no run digs this one in short and Patto flinches under it
Broad to Pattinson, no run line-and-length in the channel, tries to get Pattinson feeling for it and feel he does, the ball darting past the outside edge
Broad to Pattinson, no run good length again, slightly tighter to off stump, gets the bat behind it this time
Broad to Pattinson, no run goes fuller, slightly wide of the stumps, pushed into the covers
Swann to Harris, no run goes round the wicket, pushed across and defended coming forwards outside off
Swann to Harris, 4 byes full and pitching outside leg stump and this has absolutely ripped past Prior as Harris shouldered arms, the ball racing to long leg for byes
Swann to Harris, no run chipped back and dropped, bursts through both hands as Swann reached to his left - second drop off Swann but he'll have to fume at himself this time
Swann to Harris, no run props forward with bat next to pad and defends
Swann to Harris, no run on the stumps, drifting across, pushed back on the front foot
Swann to Harris, no run stays back and tapped square on the off side
Broad to Pattinson, no run goes round the wicket to the left-hander, digs in it short and Patto taps to point
Broad to Pattinson, no run slightly short of a length and defended to mid-off
Broad to Pattinson, no run good pace and bounce off a length in the corridor outside off, Pattinson shoulders arms
Broad to Pattinson, no run stays back to a shortish ball outside off and dabs into the covers
Broad to Pattinson, no run drops short, another nonchalant duck underneath
Broad to Pattinson, FOUR runs overpitched and driven sweetly back down the ground, gets the weight going forward and scalps four with a classical drive through mid-off
Swann to Harris, no run full and on leg stump, pushed back down the track
Swann to Harris, no run pushed through a bit quicker and flatter and defended
Innings Start
Where's short leg?
